website_summaries.verdict: A basic set of blind spot mirrors with minimal coverage for smaller side mirrors.
pros: Circular profile makes it easy to place the blind spot mirrors almost anywhere on the side mirror
Mirror rotates and sways to adjust for the best viewing angle possible
cons: Mirrors offer just a narrow, restricted view of most vehicle's blind spots

customer_reviews.title: Hands down best blind spot mirrors you can buy on amazon
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 or 3 other types of blind spot mirrors to replace the 15 year old ones I had on, I love that these have now edge so it’s relatively seamless from mirror to blind spot mirror. Also, I was able to see the vehicle In my blind spot area three lanes to my right as I was driving down the highway today. I do not have the black mounting thing attached, just put the mirrors straight on the mirror and the range is perfect.

customer_reviews.title: Helps me drive with the LA psychos!!

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and  low profile OEM look!
customer_reviews.text: While my Outback has the latest blind spot monitoring technology, I wanted the additional ability to visually see my blind spots. They are high quality glass providing a nice clear view of those pesky blind spots. So far they have gone through automatic car washes with no problems. I expect the 3M automotive tape used for mounting the mirrors to last a long time. I recommend using the center cut-out used for the swivel mount as well as the doughnut mounting tape to ensure good adhesion. I'm very pleased with this purchase.

The vehicle looks 10-15 yards away the it's at your blindspot position. At night I find it nearly impossible to use the mirrors to check for cars. They do help with the blindspot but would not recommend.

A plastic back for those who need the adjustable feature would be wonderful. Maybe the stationary and the adjustable products could be marketed separately since including all options in one package would be expensive for you and wasteful for the customer.
